column5:
That is 100% true. And I can tell you that the "American Dream" is not bound to the USA. It's a mentality that has crossed borders and fucked up an entire generation of people all over the world.
We are forever doomed to be frustrated with ourselves and resentful towards society on account of all the lies we were told growing up.

I'm very optimistic in regards of how home office will be seen after this quarantine. I believe the business model will change a lot and introverts like us will be able to work at home, at least to some extent and, of course, depending on the job.
So hopes up, maybe the quarantine doesn't have to end and we will have more leeway about that.

As already statted for those resilient humans above me, that post ir relatable as fuck. Is says something about our society, doesn't it?
Sending love and strength for you, for real. You're not alone.
Something truer has never been said.

Your education does not dictate your worth.
People are more then what they know, more then their scores on any test.
I understand that is extremely hard to take that to heart when you live in a society where that's the only part of you they care about, but trust me, you are much more than this. Please, don't let them get to you.
You're going to bounce back from this with the tools that you have at your disposal and in some years from now you're going to look back to this time and see it as something that made you stronger and wiser.
You got this. You're a valuable human being.
I feel you so much. It's what, ultimately, made me quit it.
That's me at rock bottom refusing any kind of help.
Poxa, brigadão! Tinha até esquecido que tinha postado isso aqui haha

Caramba, parabéns! Que massa!
Muito sucesso ❤️
